name: Thoughtseize
text: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card. You lose 2 life.

editions.flavor:
"Knowledge is such a burden. Release it. Release all your fears to me."
—Ashiok, Nightmare Weaver
"Any dream is a robust harvest. Still, I prefer the timeworn dreams, heavy with import, that haunt the obsessive mind."

name: Thoughts of Ruin
text: Each player sacrifices a land for each card in your hand.

editions.flavor:
"In our war with the kami, we annihilate what is our own. Do they too suffer ruination in their hidden world?"
—Diary of Azusa

name: Thought Vessel
text:
You have no maximum hand size.
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Infinite possibilities contained in a finite space.

name: Thoughtweft Gambit
text: Tap all creatures your opponents control and untap all creatures you control.

editions.flavor: The kithkin mind-bond is even tighter in Shadowmoor, reinforcing the unity of their community to the point of xenophobia.

name: Thoughtweft Trio
text:
First strike, vigilance
Champion a Kithkin (When this enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another Kithkin you control. When this leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)
Thoughtweft Trio can block any number of creatures.

name: Thousand-legged Kami
text: Soulshift 7 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 7 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

name: Thousand Winds
text:
Flying
Morph {5}{U}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Thousand Winds is turned face up, return all other tapped creatures to their owners' hands.

name: Thousand-Year Elixir
text:
You may activate abilities of creatures you control as though those creatures had haste.
{1}, {T}: Untap target creature.

editions.flavor: Paradoxically, to tilt the massive jug for a sip, you'd need the energy of the giant's tonic.
Paradoxically, to tilt the massive jug for a sip, you'd need the energy of the giant's tonic.

name: Thraben Doomsayer
text:
{T}: Create a 1/1 white Human creature token.
Fateful hour — As long as you have 5 or less life, other creatures you control get +2/+2.

editions.flavor: "Swarms of the unhallowed claw at Thraben's gates! Do you still deny the end approaches?"

name: Thraben Foulbloods
text: Delirium — Thraben Foulbloods gets +1/+1 and has menace as long as there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard. (A creature with menace can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

editions.flavor: The famed hunting hounds of House Cecani continue to prove the quality of their pedigree.

name: Thraben Gargoyle
text:
Defender
{6}: Transform Thraben Gargoyle.

editions.flavor: Runechanters engrave their strongest wards on those that protect the church.

name: Thraben Heretic
text: {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard.

editions.flavor: "Let them decry me for burning the dead. I'm not giving those ghoulcallers any more fuel for their madness."
"Let them decry me for burning the dead. I'm not giving those ghoulcallers any more fuel for their madness."

name: Thraben Inspector
text: When Thraben Inspector enters the battlefield, investigate. (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")

editions.flavor: "If you've been at this as long as I have, nothing can surprise you. That's the hope, at least."

name: Thraben Militia
text: Trample

editions.flavor: "The time for grief is over. The time for retribution has begun."

"I've learned to trust my dogs' instincts. When they're calm, I'm calm. And when they get nervous, I get my crossbow."
—Hinrik of House Cecani

name: Thraben Sentry
text:
Vigilance
Whenever another creature you control dies, you may transform Thraben Sentry.

editions.flavor: "Looks like it's going to be a quiet night."

name: Thraben Standard Bearer
text: {1}{W}, {T}, Discard a card: Create a 1/1 white Human Soldier creature token.

editions.flavor: The uncorrupted rallied under Thalia's leadership and Sigarda's banner.

name: Thraben Valiant
text: Vigilance

editions.flavor: "Once more into Devil's Breach, soldiers. I want another devil tail for my collection."
"Once more into Devil's Breach, soldiers. I want another devil tail for my collection."

name: Thragtusk
text:
When Thragtusk enters the battlefield, you gain 5 life.
When Thragtusk leaves the battlefield, create a 3/3 green Beast creature token.

editions.flavor:
"Always carry two spears."
—Mokgar, Kalonian hunter

"Always carry two spears."
—Mokgar, Kalonian hunter

name: Thran Dynamo
text: {T}: Add {C}{C}{C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Urza's metathran children were conceived, birthed, and nurtured by an integrated system of machines.
Urza's metathran children were conceived, birthed, and nurtured by an integrated system of machines.
Urza's metathran children were conceived, birthed, and nurtured by an integrated system of machines.

name: Thran Forge
text: {2}: Until end of turn, target nonartifact creature gets +1/+0 and becomes an artifact in addition to its other types.

editions.flavor: "This will work," Gerrard called to the elves as he used the forge to strengthen the aboroth, "but if it doesn't, we won't survive to care."

name: Thran Foundry
text: {1}, {T}, Exile Thran Foundry: Target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.

editions.flavor:
"What we do not use up, we use again."
—Urza

name: Thran Golem
text: As long as Thran Golem is enchanted, it gets +2/+2 and has flying, first strike, and trample.

editions.flavor: Karn felt more secure about his value to Urza when he realized he didn't need regular trimming.
As a beaver's teeth grow unchecked without regular use, so does the golem's armor grow without regular battles.
The golems of the ancient Thran still draw power in ways that baffle the artificers of today.
The golems of the ancient Thran still draw power in ways that baffle the artificers of today.
The golems of the ancient Thran still draw power in ways that baffle the artificers of today.

name: Thran Lens
text: All permanents are colorless.

editions.flavor:
"Every device in the rig is evidence of Thran enlightenment. All mana was the same to them, whether from rock or water, growth or decay. Can you imagine such unity of vision?"
—Urza, journal

name: Thran Quarry
text:
At the beginning of the end step, if you control no creatures, sacrifice Thran Quarry.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

name: Thran Tome
text: {5}, {T}: Reveal the top three cards of your library. Target opponent chooses one of those cards. Put that card into your graveyard, then draw two cards.

editions.flavor: Every line holds a tale, and between lie a thousand more.

name: Thran Turbine
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may add {C} or {C}{C} to your mana pool. You can't spend this mana to cast spells.

editions.flavor: When Urza asked the viashino what it did, they answered: "It hums."

name: Thran War Machine
text:
Echo {4} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
Thran War Machine attacks each turn if able.

text:
Echo {4} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
You may choose not to untap Thran Weaponry during your untap step.

text: {B}: Thrashing Wumpus deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

editions.flavor: Young wumpuses are malevolent and vicious—but they grow out of it.

text:
{4}: Scry 1, then reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped. Otherwise, draw a card.

editions.flavor: Beneath crashing waves lies an ocean of secrets waiting to be explored.

text:
Haste
Whenever Thraximundar attacks, defending player sacrifices a creature.

editions.flavor: His name means "he who paints the earth red."

editions.flavor:
"Over time, Konda grew ever more suspicious, fearing even his most loyal allies were being manipulated by unseen hands."

name: Threaten
text: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

name: Three Dreams
text: Search your library for up to three Aura cards with different names, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor:
"Choose one to heal, one to harm, and one to grant you the prudence to use them."

—Miotri, auratouched mage

"Choose one to heal, one to harm, and one to grant you the prudence to use them."

name: Three Tragedies
text: Target player discards three cards.

editions.flavor:
"As the kami passed over the village of Mita, the inhabitants relived their three most grievous tragedies. Some cried. Some raged. Some were driven to madness. But the next morning, none possessed the will to fight."
—Observations of the Kami War

name: Three Visits
text: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor:
"Trying to meet a worthy man in the wrong way is as bad as closing the door on an invited guest."
—Mencius, a Chinese philosopher

"Trying to meet a worthy man in the wrong way is as bad as closing the door on an invited guest."

name: Three Wishes
text: Exile the top three cards of your library face down. You may look at those cards for as long as they remain exiled. Until your next turn, you may play those cards. At the beginning of your next upkeep, put any of those cards you didn't play into your graveyard.

text: Whenever Thresher Beast becomes blocked, defending player sacrifices a land.

editions.flavor: It destroys everything in its path, including the path itself.

text: Thresher Lizard gets +1/+2 as long as you have one or fewer cards in hand.

Deathtouch
